The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this firewall section. Defaults to ID if not set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of this firewall section.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) A list of scope + tag pairs to associate with this firewall section.

properties.name: applied_to
properties.description: (Optional) List of objects where the rules in this section will be enforced. This will take precedence over rule level applied_to. [Supported target types: "LogicalPort", "LogicalSwitch", "NSGroup", "LogicalRouter"]

properties.name: section_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of the rules which a section can contain. Either LAYER2 or LAYER3. Only homogeneous sections are supported.

properties.name: stateful
properties.description: (Required) Stateful or Stateless nature of firewall section is enforced on all rules inside the section. Layer3 sections can be stateful or stateless. Layer2 sections can only be stateless.

properties.name: insert_before
properties.description: (Optional) Firewall section id that should come immediately after this one. It is user responsibility to use this attribute in consistent manner (for example, if same value would be set in two separate sections, the outcome would depend on order of creation). Changing this attribute would force recreation of the firewall section.

properties.name: list description
display_name
properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this rule. Defaults to ID if not set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of this rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Required) Action enforced on the packets which matches the firewall rule. [Allowed values: "ALLOW", "DROP", "REJECT"]

properties.name: applied_to
properties.description: (Optional) List of objects where rule will be enforced. The section level field overrides this one. Null will be treated as any. [Supported target types: "LogicalPort", "LogicalSwitch", "NSGroup", "LogicalRouterPort"]

properties.name: destination
properties.description: (Optional) List of the destinations. Null will be treated as any. [Allowed target types: "IPSet", "LogicalPort", "LogicalSwitch", "NSGroup", "MACSet" (depending on the section type)]

properties.name: destinations_excluded
properties.description: (Optional) When this boolean flag is set to true, the rule destinations will be negated.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: (Optional) Rule direction in case of stateless firewall rules. This will only considered if section level parameter is set to stateless. Default to IN_OUT if not specified. [Allowed values: "IN", "OUT", "IN_OUT"]

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Flag to disable rule. Disabled will only be persisted but never provisioned/realized.

properties.name: ip_protocol
properties.description: (Optional) Type of IP packet that should be matched while enforcing the rule. [allowed values: "IPV4", "IPV6", "IPV4_IPV6"]

properties.name: logged
properties.description: (Optional) Flag to enable packet logging. Default is disabled.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) User notes specific to the rule.

properties.name: rule_tag
properties.description: (Optional) User level field which will be printed in CLI and packet logs.

properties.name: service
properties.description: (Optional) List of the services. Null will be treated as any. [Allowed target types: "NSService", "NSServiceGroup"]

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional) List of sources. Null will be treated as any. [Allowed target types: "IPSet", "LogicalPort", "LogicalSwitch", "NSGroup", "MACSet" (depending on the section type)]

properties.name: sources_excluded
properties.description: (Optional) When this boolean flag is set to true, the rule sources will be negated.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of this resource.

properties.name: cookie_mode
properties.description: (Optional) The cookie persistence mode. Accepted values: PREFIX, REWRITE and INSERT which is the default.

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: (Required) cookie name.

properties.name: persistence_shared
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether the cookie persistence is private or shared. When false (which is the default value), the cookie persistence is private to each virtual server and is qualified by the pool. If set to true, in cookie insert mode, cookie persistence could be shared across multiple virtual servers that are bound to the same pools.

properties.name: cookie_fallback
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether once the server points by this cookie is down, a new server is selected, or the requests will be rejected.

properties.name: cookie_garble
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether the cookie value (server IP and port) would be encrypted or in plain text.

properties.name: list description
cookie_domain
properties.description: (Optional) HTTP cookie domain (for INSERT mode only).

properties.name: cookie_path
properties.description: (Optional) HTTP cookie path (for INSERT mode only).

properties.name: cookie_expiry_type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of cookie expiration timing (for INSERT mode only). Accepted values: SESSION_COOKIE_TIME for session cookie time setting and PERSISTENCE_COOKIE_TIME for persistence cookie time setting.

properties.name: max_idle_time
properties.description: (Required if cookie_expiry_type is set) Maximum interval the cookie is valid for from the last time it was seen in a request.

properties.name: max_life_time
properties.description: (Required for INSERT mode with SESSION_COOKIE_TIME expiration) Maximum interval the cookie is valid for from the first time the cookie was seen in a request.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) A list of scope + tag pairs to associate with this lb cookie persistence profile.

properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether the cookie persistence is private or shared.

properties.name: ha_persistence_mirroring
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether persistence entries will be synchronized to the HA peer.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Persistence expiration time in seconds, counted from the time all the connections are completed. Defaults to 300 seconds.

properties.name: purge_when_full
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether entries will be purged when the persistence table is full. Defaults to true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of this resource.

properties.name: active_monitor_id
properties.description: (Optional) Active health monitor Id. If one is not set, the active healthchecks will be disabled.

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: (Optional) Load balancing algorithm controls how the incoming connections are distributed among the members. Supported algorithms are: ROUND_ROBIN, WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTION, WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTION, IP_HASH.

properties.name: list description
admin_state
properties.description: (Optional) Pool member admin state. Possible values: ENABLED, DISABLED and GRACEFUL_DISABLED

properties.name: backup_member
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean flag which reflects whether this is a backup pool member. Backup servers are typically configured with a sorry page indicating to the user that the application is currently unavailable. While the pool is active (a specified minimum number of pool members are active) BACKUP members are skipped during server selection. When the pool is inactive, incoming connections are sent to only the BACKUP member(s).

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this resource. pool member name.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Required) Pool member IP address.

properties.name: max_concurrent_connections
properties.description: (Optional) To ensure members are not overloaded, connections to a member can be capped by the load balancer. When a member reaches this limit, it is skipped during server selection. If it is not specified, it means that connections are unlimited.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) If port is specified, all connections will be sent to this port. Only single port is supported. If unset, the same port the client connected to will be used, it could be overrode by default_pool_member_port setting in virtual server. The port should not specified for port range case.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Optional) Pool member weight is used for WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN balancing algorithm. The weight value would be ignored in other algorithms.

properties.name: list description
grouping_object
properties.description: (Required) Grouping object of type NSGroup which will be used as dynamic pool members. The IP list of the grouping object would be used as pool member IP setting.

properties.name: ip_version_filter
properties.description: (Optional) Ip version filter is used to filter IPv4 or IPv6 addresses from the grouping object. If the filter is not specified, both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses would be used as server IPs. Supported filtering is "IPV4" and "IPV6" ("IPV4" is the default one)

properties.name: limit_ip_list_size
properties.description: (Optional) Limits the max number of pool members. If false, allows the dynamic pool to grow up to the load balancer max pool member capacity.

properties.name: max_ip_list_size
properties.description: (Optional) Should only be specified if limit_ip_list_size is set to true. Limits the max number of pool members to the specified value.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) If port is specified, all connections will be sent to this port. If unset, the same port the client connected to will be used, it could be overridden by default_pool_member_ports setting in virtual server. The port should not specified for multiple ports case.

properties.name: min_active_members
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum number of members for the pool to be considered active. This value is 1 by default.

properties.name: passive_monitor_id
properties.description: (Optional) Passive health monitor Id. If one is not set, the passive healthchecks will be disabled.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: `snat_translation - (Optional) SNAT translation configuration for the pool.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of SNAT performed to ensure reverse traffic from the server can be received and processed by the loadbalancer. Supported types are: SNAT_AUTO_MAP, SNAT_IP_POOL and TRANSPARENT

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Required for snat_translation of type SNAT_IP_POOL) Ip address or Ip range for SNAT of type SNAT_IP_POOL.

properties.name: tcp_multiplexing_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) TCP multiplexing allows the same TCP connection between load balancer and the backend server to be used for sending multiple client requests from different client TCP connections. Disabled by default.

properties.name: tcp_multiplexing_number
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum number of TCP connections per pool that are idly kept alive for sending future client requests. The default value for this is 6.

properties.description: (Optional) A list of scope + tag pairs to associate with this lb pool.

properties.description: (Optional) The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) A list of scope + tag pairs to associate with this NAT rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Required) NAT rule action type. Valid actions are: SNAT, DNAT, NO_NAT and REFLEXIVE. All rules in a logical router are either stateless or stateful. Mix is not supported. SNAT and DNAT are stateful, and can NOT be supported when the logical router is running at active-active HA mode. The REFLEXIVE action is stateless. The NO_NAT action has no translated_fields, only match fields.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) enable/disable the rule.

properties.name: logging
properties.description: (Optional) enable/disable the logging of rule.

properties.name: match_destination_network
properties.description: (Required for action=DNAT, not allowed for action=REFLEXIVE) IP Address | CIDR. Omitting this field implies Any.

properties.name: match_source_network
properties.description: (Required for action=NO_NAT or REFLEXIVE, Optional for the other actions) IP Address | CIDR. Omitting this field implies Any.

properties.name: nat_pass
properties.description: (Optional) Enable/disable to bypass following firewall stage. The default is true, meaning that the following firewall stage will be skipped. Please note, if action is NO_NAT, then nat_pass must be set to true or omitted.

properties.name: translated_network
properties.description: (Required for action=DNAT or SNAT) IP Address | IP Range | CIDR.

properties.name: translated_ports
properties.description: (Optional) port number or port range. Allowed only when action=DNAT.

properties.name: rule_priority
properties.description: The priority of the rule which is ascending, valid range [0-2147483647]. If multiple rules have the same priority, evaluation sequence is undefined.

properties.name: importing
properties.description: » Importing
An existing Tags collection can be imported into this resource, via the following command:
terraform import nsxt_vm_tags.vm1_tags id
The above would import NSX virtual machine tags as a resource named vm1_tags with the NSX id id, where id is external ID (not the BIOS id) of the virtual machine.
